name: Butler Creek Hot Tubs and Suites Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: We had a great stay at Butler Creek. We were in the Tara Suite with another couple.
reviews.title: Peaceful & Restful
Fantastic B&B
reviews.text: Very comfortable, with a nice sitting area. It was nice to come back at the end of the day and relax in our room with a glass of wine. Everything was clean and there were even robes in the room for us to us.
As everyone else has said, Linda was very helpful and very knowledgeable about the area. She helped us map out a route for wine tours and had coupons for a large number of wineries.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable

reviews.text: The only downside was it was a it of walk into town but it was great to be away from the hustle and bustle.
reviews.title: Truly amazing by all accounts!

reviews.text: Butler Creek is a charming B&B nestled away on the edge of old town in Niagara on the Lake on a tree-lined street, close to wineries (Jackson Triggs, Stratus etc.) and restaurants, and not too far of a walk from town centre. Linda is a wonderful host, and was very accommodating and knowledgable about the area, willing to go above and beyond for her guests. We stayed in the Carolina Suite and it was very spacious and comfortable, with its own separate sitting area and ensuite bath. Rooms were tidied everyday and breakfast was delicious: fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, granola, fresh baked fruit breads and a choice of breakfast entrees, incl. stuffed French toast, bacon & eggs, blueberry pancakes etc. The coffee was great too! We were there to cycle the area and tour the wineries...Linda checked in with us each morning to see what our plans were and offered us tasting vouchers for many wineries in the area. For a small $10 maintenance fee per person, you can borrow one of the B&B's 18 bikes (mountain and cruiser styles) for your stay. This is a huge cost savings compared to bike rentals in town. Would recommend!
reviews.title: Nice and Friendly

description: Two "FIVE STAR" all "suites" B&Bs cozy and romantic for couples, honeymooners and separate suites suitable third adult or family. In close proximity for larger groups wanting accommodation nearby and breakfast together All amenities from two state-of-the-art outdoor hot tugs, premium bicycles to tour the 34 km groomed trail that follows the majestic Niagara River, professionally decorated rooms with antiques and collectibles, all ensuite bathrooms some with whirlpool tubs, private balcony, fireplace, tv/dvd combination with selection of dvds complimentary, great full hot breakfast where no lunch will be needed! Free passes to local cottage wineries for tours and tastings, reservations and discount coupons for gourmet restaurants, discounts on Niagara Falls Adventure passes, spa reservations including free gift of decadent spa product, shuttle service.
